The differences are summarized in five points:
First, the meaning and function are different.
The previous chapter clarifies the meaning of the middle way and buddha-nature, which is the seed of bodhi;
This chapter clarifies the superior function of buddha-nature, which is able to embrace the most evil icchantikas and biased non-Buddhists.
Second, cause and effect are different.
The previous chapter clarifies that the nature of cause exists in the cause and not in the effect, and the nature of effect exists in the effect and not in the cause.
This chapter clarifies that all evil aggregates are Buddha-nature, which is the nature of cause;
From the evil five aggregates, the wholesome five aggregates are born, which is also the nature of effect.
It also says that Buddha-nature is in the three times and is not in the three times. The nature of effect of the sages is both in the three times and not in the three times.

The traditional interpretation of the nature of effect is that being in the three times is the nature of effect of the responsive body, and not being in the three times is the nature of effect of the Dharma body.
This is not so. It simply explains that the nature of effect pervades both cause and effect. Why is it necessary to divide the responsive and Dharma bodies?

If the wholesome five aggregates are the Buddha-nature that pervades cause and effect, the Buddha-nature in the cause is included in the three times, and the Buddha-nature in the effect is not in the three times.
